## Language families

```{r}
glottolog |> 
  filter(str_detect(countries, "RU"),
         level == "language",
         affiliation != "Bookkeeping") |> 
  mutate(family = str_extract(affiliation, "^[\\w-]*"),
         family = str_remove(family, ",")) ->
  languages_of_Russia
```

According to Glottolog there are `r nrow(languages_of_Russia)` languages that belong to `r languages_of_Russia |> distinct(family) |> nrow()` language families. \pause

However, this list includes     

- some extinct languages, e. g. Sirenik Yupik (Eskimoâ€“Aleut), Kott (Yeniseian), Yugh (Yeniseian), Chuvan (Yukaghir), Mator (Uralic), South Itelmen (Chukotko-Kamchatkan), Eastern Itelmen (Chukotko-Kamchatkan) and others...
- minority languages spoken outside Russia, e. g. Svan (Kartvelian), Oroqen (Tungusic) and others...
- Russian Sign Language
